paper_title.en: Time-resolved emissions of bound excitons in CuInS2 crystals grown by Bridgman method

description.en: The time-resolved photoluminescence of excitons in bulky single crystalline CuInS2 grown by the Bridgman method is investigated. The spectra are decomposed into four exciton emissions among which we focus on the emission with the lowest energy peak, E-x4, centered at 1.516 eV. From the excitation intensity dependence of the emission intensity, E-x4-emission is attributed to the bound exciton and the charge state associated with the bound exciton is most likely to be neutral. The decay of E-x4-emission shows single-exponential curve with decay-time constant of 1.84 ns. According to the binding energy dependence of the emission lifetime of the bound excitons, we estimate that the recombination process of E-x4-emission includes the effects of nonradiative recombination.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI C - CURRENT TOPICS IN SOLID STATE PHYSICS, VOL 3, NO 8

paper_title.en: Growth of CuInS2 crystals from melt and their properties

description.en: CuInS2 crystals are grown from the melt with the typical compositions which are stoichiometric, In2S3 and Cu2S excess ones and the effect of the melt composition on the melt growth is examined. Large grain size crystals are grown for the melt compositions except the case Of Cu2S excess one. It is found that a small amount of CuIn5S8 is precipitated in In2S3 excess crystals by forming thin film layers in the bulk. From electrical conductivity and photo-luminescence (PL) spectra of the grown crystals, predominant native point defects characterizing their semi-conducting properties are discussed. As a result, it is suggested that native vacancy and the interstitial Cu play an important roles and a tentative band-diagram is proposed. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI C - CURRENT TOPICS IN SOLID STATE PHYSICS, VOL 3, NO 8

paper_title.en: Time-Resolved Photpluminescence Studies of Bound Excitons on CuInS2 Crystals Grown by Brigdman
Study of deep photoluminescence levels in CuInS2 crystals

description.en: Deep PL levels in bulk single-crystals of CuInS2 have been investigated. The PL spectra show three broad peaks at 0.83, 0.99, and 1.24 eV in the low energy region. The emissions are considered to be due to recombination between deep donors and deep acceptors. The deep localized levels are more likely to be attributed to deformation of the crystalline structure rather than any deviation from the stoichiometric composition. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF PHYSICS AND CHEMISTRY OF SOLIDS

paper_title.en: Photoluminescence spectra of CuInS2 Crystals in Low Energy Region
Growth of Cd1-xZnxTe (x similar to 0.04) films by hot-wall method and its evaluation

description.en: Cd1-xZnxTe(x similar to 0.04) films with a thickness of less than 300 mum are grown on a ITO/glass substrate by hot wall method for obtaining good quality and electrically high resistive poly crystals sensitive to radial rays. A suitable growth condition is examined experimentally by discussing a relation between growth parameters such as the temperatures of growth, substrate and reservoir chambers, and the physical properties of the film grown under a specified condition. sensitivity of the film to gamma-rays is examined, and a possibility of the film used as an absorbing layer for radial rays is shown. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: PVT growth of Cd1-xZnxTe(x similar to 0.04) films sensitive to radial rays

description.en: Cd1-xZnxTe(x similar to 0.04) poly-crystalline films with a thickness of less than 300 mum are grown on an ITO/glass substrate by physical vapor transport method, and the films are evaluated as a detector for radial rays. A reservoir chamber containing CdCl2 powders is provided at one end of the growth tube for obtaining films with high electrical resistance and for reducing the leakage current of the device. A relation between the growth conditions and the characteristics of the grown film is clarified, and the film grown under one of the suitable conditions shows sensitivity to radial rays. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Growth of Cd1-xZnxTe (x similar to 0.04) films by hot-wall method and its evaluation

description.en: Cd1-xZnxTe(x similar to 0.04) films with a thickness of less than 300 mum are grown on a ITO/glass substrate by hot wall method for obtaining good quality and electrically high resistive poly crystals sensitive to radial rays. A suitable growth condition is examined experimentally by discussing a relation between growth parameters such as the temperatures of growth, substrate and reservoir chambers, and the physical properties of the film grown under a specified condition. sensitivity of the film to gamma-rays is examined, and a possibility of the film used as an absorbing layer for radial rays is shown. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: PVT Growth of CS<sub>1-x</sub>Z<sub>nx</sub>Te(X~0.04)films senstive to radial rays
Stoichiometry control of some II-VI ternary solid solutions during sublimation growth

description.en: A useful method is presented to control the stoichiometric composition y in Cd1 + y(SxSe1-x) and Zn1 + y(SxSe1-x) systems. The stoichiometry y is controlled through vapor growth process by regulating the sum of chalcogen partial pressures P-ps (=Ps(2) + P-Se2), and by keeping the pressure ratio P-r (=P-S2/P-Se2) constant in each growth experiment. The electrical properties of the grown crystal change obviously depending on P-ps and it is confirmed that the deviation y from stoichiometric composition y is effectively controlled without changing the composition x. The applicability of this method to other II-VI solid solutions is presented. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Melt growth and stoichiometry control of (Cd1-xZnx)(1+y)Te single crystals

description.en: Growth of (Cd1-xZnx)(1+y)Te(CZT) single crystals is tried by a modified Bridgman method using a reservoir chamber containing Cd and Zn metals with a fixed mole ratio. The aim of this method is to obtain the single crystals with controlled deviation y from stoichiometry and homogeneous target composition x. A suitable growth condition was examined experimentally and the effectiveness of this method for controlling the deviation y from stoichiometry and the composition x is confirmed. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Melt growth and stoichiometry control of (Cd1-xZnx)(1+y)Te single crystals

description.en: Growth of (Cd1-xZnx)(1+y)Te(CZT) single crystals is tried by a modified Bridgman method using a reservoir chamber containing Cd and Zn metals with a fixed mole ratio. The aim of this method is to obtain the single crystals with controlled deviation y from stoichiometry and homogeneous target composition x. A suitable growth condition was examined experimentally and the effectiveness of this method for controlling the deviation y from stoichiometry and the composition x is confirmed. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

CuAlSe2 single crystals grown by chemical vapor transport (CVT) were plate-like and transparent ones with yellowish color and well-developed (112) surface. It was found that light transmittance of the crystals decreased with passing days after growth. The surface state of grown crystals was examined in detail by XPS method to clarify the cause and the following results were obtained. Chemical shift of Cu due to Cu-O and Cu-Se bonds was clearly observed and this suggests that the surface is oxidized at room temperature in air. The oxidation of the surface stopped after about 2 weeks and the thickness was about 0.6-2.2 mum. It was found that Al, one of the constituent elements of the compound; was lacking near surface region due to high reactivity of the element. (C) 2002 Published by Elsevier Science B.V.
